Title: Twitter Dataset for Hate Speech and Cyberbullying Detection in Indonesian Language
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Febriana, T., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiarto, A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: During the 2019 election period in Indonesia, many hate speech and cyberbullying cases have occurred in social media platforms including Twitter. The government tries to filter every negative content to be spread out during this period. However, to detect hate speech is not an easy task. This paper presents the process of developing a dataset that can be used to build a hate speech detection model. More than 1 million tweets have been successfully collected from using Twitter API. The basic preprocessing and preliminary study using machine learning was implemented. Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) algorithm was used to extract the topic for each tweet to see whether these topics can be associated with debate themes. Pretrained sentiment analysis was also applied to the dataset to generate a polarity score for each tweet. From 83,752 tweets included in the analysis step, the number of positive and negative tweets are almost the same. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cyberbullying; election; hate speech; LDA; sentiment analysis; twitter
Index Keywords: Computer crime; Information management; Sentiment analysis; Social networking (online); Speech; Statistics; Cyber bullying; election; Indonesian languages; Latent dirichlet allocations; Social media platforms; Speech detection; Spread outs; twitter; Speech recognition

Authors: Budiarto A., Febriana T., Suparyanto T., Caraka R.E., Pardamean B.
Title: Health Assistant Wearable-Based Data Science System Model: A Pilot Study
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Indonesia; Faculty of Science, National University of Malaysia, School of Mathematical Science, Bangi, 43000, Malaysia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budiarto, A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Febriana, T., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparyanto, T., Bina Nusantara University, Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Indonesia; Caraka, R.E., Faculty of Science, National University of Malaysia, School of Mathematical Science, Bangi, 43000, Malaysia; Pardamean, B., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The rapid development of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) has an impact on the innovation of new technology that gives benefits for health. One of its latest development is wearable device technology. Nowadays, the growth of this technology market is very positive. But unfortunately the growth of this technology is not followed by the availability of supporting applications that provide maximum benefits for users by utilizing personal health and activity data. This paper is intended to provide a report of our initial research in developing a health assistant solution that utilizes wearable device generated data. The whole research process is executed using Design Thinking approach that put the users as the main consideration. This initial research is started by designing a field research that can potentially gathered users' data generated from wearable device. A series of statistical and machine learning techniques are presented to analyze time series data to create a model. Finally, to implement the model, a mobile application prototype is also proposed. The outcomes from this initial research will be used to develop a fully working solution. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: data science; health assistant; mobile application; recommendation system; wearable

Title: IoT device used for air pollution campaign to encourage cycling habit in inverleith neighborhood
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budiarto, A., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Febriana, T., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper describes a collaboration research that have been accomplished together between Design Informatics Program at The University of Edinburgh and The City of Edinburgh Council (CEC) in Inverleith. CEC has several priority plans listed in 2014-2017 local community plan. One of that priorities is to improve cycling habit within the society. This project was intended to motivate people to do more cycling by creating awareness about air pollution issues. The utilization of Internet of Things (IoT devices), secondary data analysis and physical data visualization were methodology approaches used in this project. This paper explains workflow of the project, including data collection and analysis, participatory design workshop, field measurement and physical data visualization. Based on the analysis of data in this research, a series of physical installation was deployed as the outcome of this research. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Air Pollution; Analysis; Cycling; IoT; Visualization
Index Keywords: Air pollution; Data visualization; Flow visualization; Information analysis; Information management; Visualization; Analysis; Collaboration researches; Cycling; Field measurement; Methodology approaches; Participatory design; Secondary data analysis; University of Edinburgh; Internet of things

Title: Adaptive and personalized learning system as workshop complement
Source title: 2016 International Conference on Information Technology Systems and Innovation, ICITSI 2016 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Febriana, T., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kurniawan, R., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is first to (1) to determine the system flow of the existing workshop, (2) to understand the learning style and prior knowledge of each lecturer as a recommendation base for any workshops that will be applied, (3) to design ontology as the basis for system development, (4) to design and develop the system in accordance with the user requirements, (5) to provide e-learning models that fit the needs and characteristics for each lecturer, (6) to evaluate the proposed e-learning model. In this research, theoretical studies conducted on adaptive and personalized e-learning. Additional material obtained either from books or related journals as a reference in the system development. The model developed in this study were made independently in order to design more flexible ontology. Five models developed in this study, (1) prior knowledge, (2) user models, (3) the domain model, (4) content models, (5) learning path. The final output of this study is a recommendation that our proposed model can be applied as a foundation for the next stage, which is prototype development. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Deep neural networks; Learning systems; Ontology; adaptive; Design ontologies; personalized; Personalized e-learning; Personalized learning systems; Prototype development; System development; User requirements; E-learning

Title: Study of Management Information System and Organizational Culture toward the Success of several Banks in Indonesia
Source title: 2015 International Conference on Information Technology Systems and Innovation, ICITSI 2015 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Information System Bina Nusanta University, Jl.KH. Syahdan no. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Febriana, T., School of Information System Bina Nusanta University, Jl.KH. Syahdan no. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to (1) verify and estimate the correlation of Management Information System (MIS) and Organizational Culture toward the Success of Bank, (2) to identify dominant indicator of research variable, (3) to identify how much influence of MIS and OC variables toward Success of several bank in Indonesia. This research use quantitative descriptive approaching with the questionnaire as a primary data. The model which is developed, in this research is consist of two hypothesis that is examined by The Structural Equation Model (SEM) method using Lisrel 8.80 as an analysis tool. The sample is used in this research of 106 employee from five banks in Indonesia who used MIS application. The result of this research, based on fit model, obtain that the t-value of the exogenous variable greater than 1.96 with probability 0.05. In conclusion this research is clearly state that H0 is rejected and H1 is accepted, which means there is a significant correlation between Management Information System and Organizational Culture against Success of Banks simultaneously. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Banks in Indonesia; MIS; Organizational Culture; SEM; Success of Bank
Index Keywords: Management information systems; Scanning electron microscopy; Analysis tools; Exogenous variables; Indonesia; Management information system (MIS); Organizational cultures; Primary data; Structural equation modeling; Success of Bank; Information management
